geo_dataset.title: Large Marine Ecosystems
geo_dataset.comment: Created from [LME shapefiles](https://www.sciencebase.gov/catalog/item/55c77722e4b08400b1fd8244) by ISIMIP data team.

geo_dataset.title: Regional Marine Ecosystem masks
geo_dataset.comment: Binary masks describing the 21 ocean regions for the regional modelling activities in the fisheries and marine ecosystems available at 0.25° and 1° resolution. These masks have been used for the ocean forcing data extractions (see CRF part of this table).

forest_stand.title: Hyytiälä
forest_stand.comment: Note that an experimental plot of pine contains a lot of data while footprint of flux tower is larger. Please note that the deciduous admixtures only appear in the data at a later stage and hence do not need to be simulated. Only simulate pine and spruce (no hard-woods) and regenerate as pure pine stand

forest_stand.title: Peitz
forest_stand.comment: Managed using a weak thinning from below.

forest_stand.title: Kranzberg Roof Project
forest_stand.comment: Unmanaged/ thinning from below in past 20 years for all species.

category.title: Climate related forcing
category.description: Forcing data describing physical or chemical systems, in particular the climate, the oceans, and the cryosphere.

category.title: Static geographic information
category.description: Geographic or other time-independent information, such as land-sea masks, or river routing networks.

category.title: Direct human forcing
category.description: Independent additional forcing data, which influence climate impacts, such as land-use, population or economic changes.

bias_adjustment.description: Refers to W5E5 data used for the bias-correction globally on a 0.5° grid.
Indicates that no bias correction was performed on the climate data (e.g. ocean data).

variable.comment: All consumers (trophic level >1, vertebrates and invertebrates)

variable.long_name: Total Catch in log10 Weight Bins

Catch at sea of all pelagic consumers (trophic level >1, vertebrates and invertebrates)
Catch at sea of pelagic species with L infinity <30 cm

variable.long_name: Catch Density of Medium Pelagics >=30cm and <90cm
variable.comment: Catch at sea of pelagic species with L infinity >=30 cm and <90 cm
Catch at sea of pelagic species with L infinity >=90 cm
Catch at sea of all demersal consumers (trophic level >1, vertebrates and invertebrates)
Catch at sea of demersal species with L infinity <30 cm

variable.comment: Catch at sea of demersal species with L infinity >=30 cm and <90 cm
Catch at sea of demersal species with L infinity >=90 cm

climate_scenario.description: GCM-based pre-industrial climate related forcing, CO₂ and CH₄ concentrations fixed at 1850 levels.
GCM-based historical climate related forcing, historical changes in CO₂ and CH₄ concentrations.
GCM-based climate related forcing according to SSP1-2.6.
GCM-based climate related forcing according to SSP3-7.0.
GCM-based climate related forcing according to SSP5-8.5.

harmonization.title: Default
harmonization.description: Model should use their individual “best representation” of the historical period with regard to sowing dates, harvesting dates, fertilizer application rates and crop varieties.

harmonization.title: Fully harmonized
harmonization.description: Simulations based on prescribed “present day” fertilization rates (available for download) and fixed planting and harvesting dates (also available for download). Modelers should have planting as closely as possible to these dates, but it may be admissible to use these dates as indicators for planting windows (depending on model specifics).

harmonization.title: Harmonized seasons with no N constraints
harmonization.description: For models with an explicit description of the nitrogen cycle: harmnon simulations should be run with nitrogen stress turned off completely or (if that’s not possible) with very high N application rates to make model results comparable between those GGCMs that have explicit N dynamics and those that do not. For models without the nitrogen cycle: harmnon and fullharm simulations are the same and do not need to be duplicated. Please contact the sector coordination to push on with this side branch.

simulation_round.title: ISIMIP3a
simulation_round.description: Historical model evaluation and attribution runs

simulation_round.title: ISIMIP3b
simulation_round.description: GCM-based simulations assuming fixed 2015 direct human influences for the future

group.title: Tier 2: Complete ssp585 adapt runs for IMAGE and GFDL-ESM4
Tier 3: Complete land use models for GFDL-ESM4 (ssp126)
Tier 4: Complete land use models for UKESM1-0-LL (ssp585, ssp126)
Tier 5: Complete land use models for MPI-ESM1-2-HR (ssp585, ssp126)
Tier 6: Complete land use models for IPSL-CM6A-LR (ssp585, ssp126)
Tier 7: Complete land use models for MRI-ESM2-0 (ssp585, ssp126)
Climate-related forcing for sensitivity experiments (30arcsec, 90arcsec, 300arcsec, 1800arcsec, 60arcmin, 1955-riverine-input, otherwise identical to obsclim)
Climate related forcing (picontrol, historical, ssp126, ssp370, ssp585)
Climate-related forcing for the "varlightning" sensitivity experiment (otherwise identical to forcings above)
Climate-related forcing for the "de-biased" sensitivity experiment (otherwise identical to forcings above)
Direct human forcing (ssp126soc-noadapt, ssp126soc-adapt, ssp370soc-noadapt, ssp370soc-adapt, ssp585soc-noadapt, ssp585soc-adapt)

soc_scenario.description: Varying direct human influences in the historical period.
soc_scenario.description_note: Please label your model run `histsoc` **even if** it only partly accounts for varying direct human forcings while another part of the the direct human forcing is considered constant or is ignored.

soc_scenario.description: Fixed year-2015 direct human influences (e.g. land use, nitrogen deposition and fertilizer input, fishing effort) for the future period, if the historical period was using varying direct human influences in the historical period.
soc_scenario.description_note: Please label your simulations `2015soc-from-histsoc` for the future period, if your model run extends a historical period which used the `histsoc` scenario. This distinguishes the data from experiments which use both `2015soc` in the past and the future. If your model output is identical for both cases, please only submit the `2015soc` files for the future period.

Please only label your model run `nat` if it does not at all account for any direct human forcings, including e.g. human land use or fishing. For Nitrogen deposition please use the prepared files (with the values for 1850) or specify which other preindustrial value you used in the model documentation.

soc_dataset.title: Fishing effort
soc_dataset.resolution: Marine ecosystems or exclusive economic zones

variables.long_name: The generic name of the FAO area in which the Effort/Catch is occurring
The EEZ / high seas name in which the Effort/Catch is occurring
The generic name of the Large Marine ecosystem in which the Effort/Catch is occurring
Functional Group of the target species
Nominal (i.e. not including the technological creep) fishing effort corresponding to the reported catch
Nominal (i.e. not including the technological creep) fishing effort corresponding to the illegal catch and discards
Year (end of the year) when the Effort/Catch is occurring
Number of 0.5 degree cell making up the area
Fishing country, in ISO3 notation. Ex supranational entities (USSR, Yugoslavia) are disaggregated to their constituent countries. Serbian Fishing Effort included with Montenegro
Fishing sector (artisanal/industrial), defined by the law of the country (varies by country)
A number code to the LME, as per NOAA notation
A number code to the FAO area

soc_dataset.comment: Data comprise the nominal effort of industrial and artisanal fleets aggregated into 6 functional groups. Source: [Rousseau et al. (2019)](https://doi.org/10.1073/pnas.1820344116).

product.title: Input Data
product.description: The data used to drive the impact models, exactly as described in the ISIMIP simulation protocol.

product.title: Secondary Input Data
product.description: Data that have been derived from or are related to the input data, but not described in the simulation protocol (e.g. with a different spatial or temporal resolution).

product.title: Output Data
product.description: The climate-impacts simulation data provided by participating modelling groups, corresponding to the output variables described in the ISIMIP simulation protocol.

product.title: Secondary Output Data
product.description: Data that have been derived by processing the ISIMIP output data, but do not correspond to output variables described in the simulation protocol.

forcing_data.title: GDP data

forcing_data.title: Oceanic forcings based on de-biased atmospheric forcings
forcing_data.comment: Simulated by the ocean biogeochemistry model ocean-biogeochemistry NEMO-PISCES forced by a de-biased version of the IPSL-CM6A-LR-based atmospheric forcing, used for the **de-biased** sensitivity experiment.

forcing_data.title: De-biased oceanic forcing based on observed oceanic data for individual variables and regions.
GDP data
